subject: Re: Thanks and more stuff
author: LC Duplatt
full_text:
Oh, Bruce...I agree.  

The stuff I have been working on outside this ghost box stuff was 
completely led by "spirits" on the other side.  My job, if you will, 
was to begin a website and build it for the sole purpose of getting 
others to consider that there might be more than the physical realm.  
That led to Angels & Ghosts in 2004, and I had no idea why that name 
was given, but I went with it.  I love the tech side, but have felt 
the goal of A & G was to make people think and decide for themselves. 
There are plenty of the debunkers, TAPS type investigators out there, 
and that was not the vision I had been given (though I like that 
approach).  We recieve submissions from all over the world of audio, 
pictures, videos, stories, etc, and then I post much if it monthly.  
Again, the site's flavor is "you decide."  In the digital age, there 
is no way to authenticate what's absolutely truth, from fiction.  So, 
again my mantra has been, "You decide."  Do I think everything on A & 
G is of ghosts and spirits?  Nah...not my job to anyway.  I make it 
interesting, and allow the minds of the visitors to decide.  That's 
been my job and the spirits' beckoning.  They want people to begin 
looking for more than what the five sense can bring them.  I feel 
they speak often, but we don't listen enough.  However, I also feel 
they speak often and we think it is coincidence or better yet our own 
thoughts - LOL. ;)  

January of '07 began with a dream and a "new technology" I was to 
work on that would be big.  I sort of blew it off as a pizza dream, 
but then was led to contact people from my past for "other purposes" 
of business  This of course unwittingly led back to this whole 
communication box, again.  They (spirits) will not let up on me.

So I am working on projects and I get nudged in the spirit to get on 
this box thing again.  I pop on here, see the latest news with the RS 
Hack (they bugged me as soon as it broke, but I stalled a few days) 
and am now running experiments, etc with it.  I am posting articles, 
videos and audio about it to spread the word.  More to come...

LC
AngelsGhosts.com

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday 
<paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:
>
> 
> LC,
>  
> They not only see a bigger picture but have set all the wheels for 
it in motion.
> These new rapid developments are not pure chance or coincidence.
> We as researchers and developers have been set on a path and we 
will follow it until our job
> is done.
>  
> Bruce
> Bruce Halliday 
> 
> 
> To: EVP-ITC@...: lcdupla@...: Thu, 20 Dec 2007 00:51:14 
+0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Thanks and more stuff
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Perhaps those on the other side are more urgent, anxious and 
excited about the box breakthroughs than even we are. Could it be 
because they see a bigger picture coming to pass?- LC--- In EVP-
ITC@yahoogroups.com, "psi_research" <vilhellm@> wrote:>> Hi Ursula,> 
> There is a certain urgency to Box messages - sort of like they need 
> to convey quickly. The same thing happens in video ITC, it's like > 
there is but a moment and we all better pay attention. -Bill> > --- 
In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Ursula Bielski <ursulabielski@> > wrote:> 
>> > Willy, Really interested in listening to the new files. I'll let 
> you know after.> > Just to throw in regarding EVP maker and 
everything else but the > boxes. I used EVP maker and the water 
method AND foreign language > broadcast method and radio static and 
box fan, etc etc etc before I > got my shack hack and my Joe's box, 
and I must admit that I have put > everything else aside even though 
I got good results with ALL of > those other methods. There's just 
something very exciting about the > boxes, I think, that makes us 
forsake all others. When I started > using a hack, which Jeff Rezman 
made for me before I got the Joe's > Box, I felt it was a nervous 
sort of experimentation--that is to say, > the loud, short, fast 
sound clips had me on edge, as I was used to > quiet static and 
water, but I think now I'm addicted to the sound and > the frenzy of 
it! Does anyone else feel this way?> > Ursula> > > > billliscomb 
williscomb@ wrote:> > Ursula and Misty  thank you very much for your 
feedback. > I > > really appreciate you taking the time to listen, 
and for the > > comments, especially noting the dual layers of 
speech. Interesting. > > Frank S. - Thanks for the recent files from 
EVPmaker - nice! > > There hasn't been much discussion regarding 
EVPmaker lately, so I > > wasn't' sure if it was a viable tool to 
use. I haven't read many > > older posts, but hope to get caught up 
during the holidays. Have > you > > or others considered modifying 
speech synthesis software to > generate > > random sounds? I wonder 
how something like that would work> > On the 16th I did three 
3minute recordings and got 9 clips from > > them. In this session, I 
was asking questions regarding a knocking > > sound I heard while 
going to sleep or waking up about 12 years ago. > > My life situation 
wasn't the best at that time. It was always three > > knocks, and 
once a doorbell, but not the doorbell for where I was > > then 
living. Started the Knocking session by telling "Rick" that I > > got 
messages from previous session, got "Well, he's got patience!" > > 
for response. Then was told, "Aye, it smells in here." Next asked > > 
them what sound did I hear back then, and got "it was knocking > 
(maybe > > nothing?)" The best one so far is; "Our earthbound 
forefathers are > > video programs." A second voice keeps 
repeating "Ent" syllable > > during this one. I have put these files 
in a new folder called > > Knocking, which is under Laptop MP3s. More 
comments there. > > I'm making progress on getting the software 
needed to do > > linear scanning with the Radio Shark 2 USB am/fm 
radio and hope to > > have it up and running within the next week or 
two. > > Thanks again to all> > Willy> >>
